thread.title: Police called to Minadeo Elementary School in Squirrel Hill
thread.title_full: Police called to Minadeo Elementary School in Squirrel Hill

author: Andrew Goldstein / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Police called to Minadeo Elementary School in Squirrel Hill

organizations.name: minadeo elementary school in squirrel hill police

text:
Police called to Minadeo Elementary School in Squirrel Hill February 21, 2017 9:33 PM By Andrew Goldstein /   
Pittsburgh police responded this afternoon to a Squirrel Hill elementary school when a student became “very physically aggressive” with staff members, a school spokeswoman said. 
The incident occurred around afternoon dismissal time at Minadeo Elementary School. 
Pittsburgh Public Schools spokeswoman Ebony Pugh said a special education student “kind of lost control today and was physically aggressive with staff members in the classroom.” 
Ms. Pugh said the student was in an emotional support program at the school, and the incident occurred in an emotional support classroom. 
Ms. Pugh said the student bit several staff members but did not say if he did anything else. She could not describe the severity of the injuries or say whether the staff members sought medical attention. 
Officials contacted the student’s parents, Ms. Pugh said, and he was taken home. 
She did not provide the name, age or grade of the student. She also would not say whether the student will face disciplinary action. 
A witness who called the Post-Gazette said nine city police cars came to the school, and a short time later a student was led out in handcuffs. Ms. Pugh said the student was detained, but she could not confirm whether he was placed in handcuffs. 
A spokeswoman for Pittsburgh police referred questions to the school district. 
Andrew Goldstein: or 412-263-1352.
